newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela's Jan-Nov 1996 imports off 18.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela's Jan-Nov 1996 imports off 18.5 pct.

text.p: The value of Venezuelan imports between January and November 1996 dropped 18.5 percent to $8.325 billion, compared to $10.209 billion in 1995, according to the Central Office of Statistics and Information (OCEI).
The private sector accounted for the vast majority of imports with 83.7 percent of the total.

The United States was the top exporter to Venezuela with 41.3 percent, followed by Colombia with 7.1 percent and Germany with 4.5 percent. Japan accounted for 3.5 percent of imports, and France 1.9 percent.
